trans-unit.source: Triangle primitive for building a 3-D shape.
MeshGeometry3D allows the developer to specify position, normal, and texture coordinate information.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D.Positions%2A> property is required.
Normals are assumed to be associated with the front faces of a mesh primitive.
The winding order (the order in which the Positions that make up each triangle of the mesh are specified) determines whether a given face is front-facing or back-facing.
Front-facing triangles are wound in counter-clockwise order; back-facing triangles are wound in clockwise order.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref> class.
Gets the bounding <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>.
Bounding <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets a collection of normal vectors for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>.
Normal vectors are vectors perpendicular to the face of each triangle that defines a mesh.
Normals determine whether a given triangle face is lit.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> allows the developer to specify position, normal, and texture coordinate information.
Normals are assumed to be associated with the front faces of a mesh primitive.
The winding order (the order in which the Positions that make up each triangle of the mesh are specified) determines whether a given face is front-facing or back-facing.
If normals are not specified, their generation depends on whether the developer has specified triangle indices for the mesh.
If triangle indices are specified, normals will be generated that take into account adjacent faces.
If triangle indices are not specified, only one normal will be generated for the specified triangle.
This might cause a faceted appearance in the mesh.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3DCollection"></xref> that contains the normal vectors for the MeshGeometry3D.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D.Normals"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a collection of vertex positions for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>.
The points specifed by this property represent the vertices of the triangles that make up a 3-D mesh.
The winding order (the order in which the Positions that make up each triangle of the mesh are specified) determines whether a given face is front-facing or back-facing.
Front-facing triangles are wound in counter-clockwise order; back-facing triangles are wound in clockwise order.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3DCollection"></xref> that contains the vertex positions of the MeshGeometry3D.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D.Positions"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a collection of texture coordinates for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>.
Texture coordinates determine how a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material> is mapped to the vertices of the triangles that make up a mesh.
**Note** If no texture coordinates are specified for a MeshGeometry3D, its Material might not render as expected.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.PointCollection"></xref> that contains the texture coordinates for the MeshGeometry3D.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D.TextureCoordinates"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a collection of triangle indices for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D"></xref>.
For a triangle in a given 3-D mesh, the order in which the triangle's vertex positions are specified determines whether the triangle face is a front or back face.

The [Windows Presentation Foundation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f667bd15-2134-41e9-b4af-5ced6fafab5d) 3-D implementation uses a counter-clockwise winding order; that is, the points that determine a front-facing mesh triangle's positions should be specified in counterclockwise order, as viewed from the front of the mesh.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D.TriangleIndices%2A> property is optional.
If the indices are not specified, triangles are drawn in a non-indexed fashion.
Every set of three positions becomes a triangle.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
Collection that contains the triangle indices of the MeshGeometry3D.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D.TriangleIndices"></xref> dependency property.
